shortHelp.en:
An elevator pitch (value statement) that describes the epic in a clear and concise way.

- For <customers>
- Who<do something>
- The <solution>
- Is a <something - the "how">
- That <provides this value>
- Unlike <competitor, current solution or non-existing solution>
- Our solution <does something better - the "why">
shortHelp.de:
An elevator pitch (value statement) that describes the epic in a clear and concise way.

- For <customers>
- Who<do something>
- The <solution>
- Is a <something - the "how">
- That <provides this value>
- Unlike <competitor, current solution or non-existing solution>
- Our solution <does something better - the "why">

shortHelp.en: The measurable benefits that the business can anticipate if the epic hypothesis is proven to be correct.
shortHelp.de: The measurable benefits that the business can anticipate if the epic hypothesis is proven to be correct.

shortHelp.en: The early measures that will help predict the business outcome hypothesis. For more on this topic, see the Innovation Accounting advanced topic article.
shortHelp.de: The early measures that will help predict the business outcome hypothesis. For more on this topic, see the Innovation Accounting advanced topic article.

shortHelp.en: Nonfunctional requirements (NFRs) associated with the epic.
shortHelp.de: Nonfunctional requirements (NFRs) associated with the epic.

shortHelp.en: Capacity defined by Solution Train Engineer
shortHelp.de: Capacity defined by Solution Train Engineer

shortHelp.en: This is a workaround attribute to bypass duplicated type definitions and messed up references in Solution and Program level. For production the references should be derived from Features
shortHelp.de: This is a workaround attribute to bypass duplicated type definitions and messed up references in Solution and Program level. For production the references should be derived from Features
